name: Wiring Modifications to a Panel or Switchboard Inspection
template name: ASI-OP-OP-ITS-0122 Wiring Modifications to a Panel or Switchboard Inspection Rev 3

name: 1 - Confirm the equipment is de-energized and is safely isolated.
2 - Check and confirm the equipment nameplate data is the correct Panel / Switchboard.
3 - Record test equipment number and verify calibration status.
4 - Check and confirm the wiring modifications that have been completed match the latest drawings and SLD’s.
5 - Confirm all modification wiring and terminations are as per the specifications requirements.
6 - Confirm the general arrangement of installation is as shown on the drawings.
Attach a photo of each join
7 - Confirm all earthing and bonding of all equipment is as per the drawings and specification.
8 - Check and confirm all equipment is undamaged, installed in accordance with manufacturer's instructions with sufficient clearance and accessibility for operation and maintenance.
9 - Confirm all auxiliary devices are installed as per the manufacturer’s recommendations and correctly terminated. Verify all IS barriers and associated components correctly installed and earthed.
10 - Confirm that all checks as required by manufacturer have been completed. Attach manufacturer's check sheet to this form.
11 - Confirm the equipment IP rating has not been compromised.
12 - Confirm all equipment is clean and free from dust / debris, including internals.
13 - Confirm all doors, gland plates are correctly mounted.
14 - Confirm all panel-front components, indicators, lamps, meters are securely mounted and undamaged.
15 - Confirm all switching devices rating and tagging match the drawings.
16 - Check all switching devices for correct mechanical operation.
17 - Confirm that all testing as required by the specification has been completed and recorded.
18 - Confirm the Panel / Switchboard is ready to be re-energised as / when required.

19 - Confirm the installation is as per the manufacturer / project documentation and drawings. Ensure any discrepancies between design drawings and installation are clearly recorded as per project procedure. (I.E. As Built Dwgs)
20 - Confirm all Punch-list items are recorded as per project procedure.
